intro: Paraboea paraboeoides, commonly known as the broad-leafed paraboea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in forest understories and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
